availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Jefferson Tribble (Madison County, teacher and soldier)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, teacher and soldier. Madison County native. Son of John Tribble and Martha White Tribble. Married to Martha Mildred Ballew Tribble on January 21, 1861. Father of Tom Tribble. Resident in Madison County in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Madison County in 1850. Common school teacher in Madison County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Madison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 2, p. 249B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 2, p. 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Division 1, p. 109.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Division 1, p. 20.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Foxtown, p. 19.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000183317, p. 63.
Kentucky Death Records on Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #7017524, All Counties Death, p. 581.
